article_title: Mom Can't Sue Employer, Insurer For Gender Bias Against Son
article_text:
Mom Can't Sue Employer, Insurer For Gender Bias Against Son

Law360, New York (May 11, 2016, 8:24 PM ET) -- A Minnesota nurse can't bring gender bias claims against her employer for providing insurance that denied her son’s gender-reassignment surgery and related prescriptions, nor can she sue insurer HealthPartners Inc., as they weren’t involved in the matter, a federal judge ruled Wednesday.



U.S. District Judge Richard H. Kyle said HealthPartners wasn’t the administrator of Brittany R. Tovar’s plan and isn’t able to redress any of her alleged injuries. He also found she doesn’t have standing to sue provider Essentia Health, as her son faced the alleged...

To view the full article, register now.
